page.title: 08Stonegate Church
page.content: Stonegate was originally part of the ecclesiastical parish of Ticehurst.In 1838 the first church of St.Peter was built in the northern end of the present churchyard.In 1869 Stonegate became a separate parish.By 1903 the church building had developed alarming cracks and could not be repaired.The present church was given by Mr.G.J. Courthope of Whiligh and was consecrated in 1904.For a short time both churches were standing. The parish of Stonegate has a population of about 400,and nearly 100 churchmembers.Stonegate is in the Deanery of Rotherfield,the Archdeaconry of Lewes and Hastings,and the Diocese of Chichester.We have our own Parish Magazine with a monthly circulation of 130.
